p: The landscape was comprised of 5 × 5 km (25 km 2) grid cells arranged similarly to the outbreak area (Figure 1, Figure S2). Grid cells each had a carrying capacity of 0.5–2 boars/km 2, which controlled heterogeneity in population density across the landscape through density‐dependent reproduction. The total landscape size was 120 × 50 km (6,000 km 2).
